question: Let <katex>$A=\{x,y,z,u\}$</katex> and <katex>$B=\{a,b\}$</katex>. A function <katex>$f:A\rightarrow B$</katex> is selected randomly. The probability that the function is an onto function is
explanation: Functions not onto (range is subset of B): Functions mapping only to {a} (1) or only to {b} (1). Total 2.
